results.title: What Happened to Hu Jintao?
results.abstract: We deconstruct video footage of the surprising moment when the former Chinese leader was escorted out of the highly choreographed Communist Party Congress.
results.byline: By Agnes Chang, Vivian Wang, Isabelle Qian and Ang Li

results.title: Scarred by War, Ukraine’s Children Face Years of Trauma
results.abstract: For countless Ukrainian children, the war has brought long-term physical and psychological injuries. Those who have suffered serious physical harm or the loss of a parent now face a challenging path forward.
results.byline: By Megan Specia and Brendan Hoffman

multimedia.caption: Maryna Ponomariova, 6, whose left leg had to be amputated below the knee after a devastating attack on her home in Kherson, is now learning to walk again with the help of Nazar Borozniuk at Ohmadyt Children’s Hospital in Kviv, Ukraine, earlier this month.
multimedia.copyright: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times
